items.title: Piramal Finance Retail CEO to lead IndusInd Bank's consumer business

Mallareddy, who previously worked with Anand at Axis Bank, will oversee both asset and liability sides of retail banking.

Both nations aim to boost supply chains and economic resilience, with further negotiations expected to expand bilateral trade towards a $500 billion target.

items.title: Reading between the lines of Budget 2026: What it signals for markets, growth and key sectors
items.summary: Budget 2026-27 aims to accelerate economic growth while balancing fiscal prudence. Key highlights include a rise in STT, TCS relief for travellers, Rs 12.2 lakh crore Capex, incentives for IT, semiconductor, and BioPharma sectors, and a focus on digital and physical infrastructure. The budget supports markets, growth, and sectoral expansion.

This potential integration would allow seamless transactions for Indian travelers abroad and vice-versa. The decision hinges on a thorough evaluation of data security, IT system safeguarding, and geopolitical considerations.

items.summary: US Senator Lindsey Graham on Monday (local time) claimed that India has "earned" the reduction in tariffs under the newly announced India-US trade deal, linking the move to the decrease in Russian oil purchases by New Delhi amid the ongoing war in Ukraine.

items.title: Indian refiners need wind-down period for Russian oil, sources say
items.summary: Indian refiners require a transition period to cease Russian oil imports, as existing booked shipments are scheduled to arrive in March. This comes after a trade agreement between the US and India, where President Trump announced India's commitment to halt Russian oil purchases and increase imports from the United States and potentially Venezuela.

items.title: India gains edge over regional export competitors after tariffs drop to 18%, beats China, Bangladesh
items.summary: India, US trade deal: India now enjoys a significant trade advantage with the United States. Washington has reduced tariffs on Indian products to 18 percent. This move places India ahead of regional export rivals like Indonesia, Bangladesh, and Vietnam. The deal also sees India's tariffs on US goods reduced. This development is a major boost for Indian exports and strengthens bilateral trade ties.

Industrialists have praised the deal as a major achievement for India's economic standing on the global stage.

items.summary: India is perfecting a growth model designed to function with clinical efficiency, while quietly leaving its vast labour force behind

items.title: Budget 2026: DEA Secy asks companies to invest in critical sectors
items.summary: The government, Anuradha Thakur said, intends to stay on the fiscal consolidation path and reduce its debt-to-GDP ratio. This will weigh down the Centre's borrowing costs and free up resources for priority sector spending, Thakur said at a post-budget event, organised by the Confederation of Indian Industry.

items.title: HAL's civil aviation plans take off, company eyes commercial market
items.summary: State-owned HAL is shifting focus to the commercial aviation market. The company aims for 25% of its revenue from this sector within five years. HAL plans to leverage aircraft like the SJ-100 and Hindustan-228 for this expansion. This move is supported by government incentives for local aircraft manufacturing. HAL is also collaborating with Russian firms for aircraft production and leasing.

items.title: Need for inclusive credit strategies for unbanked population: DFS secretary to banks
items.summary: New initiatives aim to boost credit access for the unbanked. The BAANKNET app and Digital Balance Confirmation Platform were launched to streamline property auctions and audits. The PSB Alliance is encouraged to broaden its services. These steps support financial inclusion and efficiency. India's banking sector shows robust health with declining NPAs and steady credit growth.

items.title: PF exemptions to now align in full with EPFO rules
items.summary: The Union Budget proposes changes to provident fund trust rules. These changes aim to simplify business operations and reduce legal disputes. Employer contributions to provident funds will no longer need to match employee contributions. Tax on employer contributions exceeding 12% of wages is also being removed.

items.title: Microfinance companies fail to get budget-day wish, hope to bask in others' sunlight
items.summary: Budget 2026: The microfinance sector did not receive budget credit guarantee support. However, it anticipates that proposals aimed at increasing rural incomes will enhance the repayment capacity of its customers. Focus on fisheries, animal husbandry, and high-value agriculture through credit-linked programs is expected to strengthen income diversification.

items.title: Carbon capture push in Budget 2026 builds up steel & cement companies' confidence
items.summary: India's government is investing ₹20,000 crore over five years in carbon capture technology. This funding will aid hard-to-abate industries like steel and cement. These sectors face high emissions and significant costs for low-carbon solutions. The move signals strong policy support for industrial decarbonisation. It aims to help these industries meet climate goals while expanding production capacity.

items.title: Budget 2026: Tax reforms mark shift to trust-based regime, says CBDT chief
items.summary: Explaining the hike in securities transaction tax (STT) on derivatives, CBDT chairman Ravi Agrawal said that the reforms regarding the minimum alternative tax (MAT) will push more companies to the new tax regime, adding that the government will honour all accumulated MAT credit up to March 31 for companies shifting to the new 22% tax regime.

items.title: In temple run from Varanasi to Sikkim, faith's in fast lane
items.summary: India's spiritual travel sector is poised for significant growth. The government is investing heavily in temple towns and Buddhist circuits. New high-speed rail corridors will connect major pilgrimage sites. This focus on infrastructure and amenities will attract more travelers, including families and experience seekers, to destinations like Ayodhya and Varanasi.

items.title: Priority is growth; demand seen keeping up pace, says Nirmala Sitharaman after Budget 2026
items.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman is confident consumption will remain strong. She defended the increased tax on derivative trading, aiming to deter speculation. The government plans to boost disinvestment and asset monetisation to fund its fiscal goals. Amendments to the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code are also planned for the latter half of the budget session.

items.title: A quiet confidence: How India’s Budget steadies the economy in a turbulent world
items.summary: India's latest budget reflects a quiet confidence in navigating global economic shifts.  The nation's economic foundations are firm, with strong growth expected.  Fiscal discipline is evident, with a clear path to reduce debt.  Reforms continue to improve the ease of doing business.  The corporate bond market is being deepened.  These measures signal India's readiness for global investment and financial integration.

items.title: Govt's support to put homes within reach of more people
items.summary: Home loan demand is set for a significant boost. The Union Budget has sharply increased subsidy allocations for key housing schemes. This move will directly improve affordability and credit uptake, especially for first-time homebuyers and lower-income households. Housing finance companies anticipate a more sustainable demand environment. The schemes will also generate employment during construction.

items.title: Budget 2026: SEZ domestic sale a one-time Step, says Revenue Secretary
items.summary: The government has introduced a special one-time measure for Special Economic Zone units. This allows eligible manufacturing units to sell products in the domestic market at concessional duty rates. Revenue Secretary Arvind Shrivastava stated this is a limited-time window. The aim is to help these export-oriented businesses manage global trade volatilities.

items.title: Tight fiscal room won't affect infra creation capex: Expenditure secy
items.summary: The government will maintain its focus on infrastructure development through increased capital expenditure, despite fiscal constraints and global economic uncertainty. Expenditure Secretary V. Vualnam dismissed concerns from states regarding the discontinuation of revenue deficit grants, emphasizing the need for states to manage their own expenditure. The Centre has enhanced funding for state-level capital investment schemes to encourage public investment-led growth.

items.title: India-US trade deal: US cuts tariffs to 18%, India gains edge over regional peers
items.summary: The US has slapped a 50% tariff on Brazil, 30% on South Africa and 25% on Mexico. Developed economies such as Canada face a 35% tariff and Switzerland 39%.

items.title: MPC Meet: A rate cut’s unlikely with growth strong, liquidity call in focus: Poll
items.summary: Reserve Bank of India is expected to keep interest rates unchanged. Economists foresee a neutral to dovish stance from Governor Sanjay Malhotra. Liquidity support measures and a new open market operation calendar are anticipated. The Monetary Policy Committee will assess budget impacts on inflation, growth, and liquidity. Inflation is projected to stay near the 4% target, while growth remains strong.

items.title: Manufacturing push key to strong rupee in long run: CEA Anantha Nageswaran

items.title: Centre planning underground rail tracks along 40-km corridor connecting Northeast, rest of India: Ashwini Vaishnaw
items.summary: Plans are underway to lay underground railway tracks along a 40-km strategic corridor in West Bengal. This vital route, known as the 'Chicken's Neck', will connect the northeast with the rest of India. The existing double line will also be converted to a four-line track. This development enhances connectivity and security for the region.

items.title: Coal block allocation now only via auctions: Government
items.summary: The move aligns with the High-Level Committee framework to enhance domestic production, reduce imports and promote commercial exploration in India’s coal sector

items.title: Railways’ annual allocation for Tamil Nadu up 15% to ₹7,611 crore in FY27
items.summary: Funds jump ninefold, electrification nears completion, land acquisition lags Statewide

items.title: Government mulls LIC stake sale via FPO in next financial year
items.summary: Currently holding 96.5% of LIC, the government needs to sell an additional 6.5% to meet the 10% public shareholding mandate by May 2027, after offloading 3.5% via the 2022 IPO

items.title: Balancing on 41%: Why the 16th Finance Commission refused to budge on devolution
items.summary: The 16th Finance Commission has walked a high-wire, balancing southern efficiency against northern equity. By rewarding GDP growth and axing deficit grants, the new formula shifts India from entitlement to performance. Our explainer on the commission’s report, and why many states remain upset.

items.title: From aspiration to achievement: Reform express gains momentum in Budget 2026–27
items.summary: Budget 2026–27 reflects a constructive policy dialogue between government and stakeholders

items.title: Coal blocks to be allotted only through auctions: Govt
items.summary: The government has successfully auctioned 136 coal blocks since 2020. Future allocations will also follow a competitive bidding process.  The Minister of State for Coal stated that the government is open to examining Telangana's proposal for the Tadicherla coal block.  This move aims to ensure decisions are made in the people's interest and as per law.

items.title: PB Fintech board to consider QIP to fund inorganic growth
items.summary: The proposed fundraising will involve the issuance of equity shares through a QIP to eligible institutional investors, subject to shareholder and regulatory approvals.

items.title: India’s GDP growth seen at 6.7% in FY27, 7% in FY28 on strong consumption: S&P Global Ratings
items.summary: Robust consumer spending and public investments will maintain India's real GDP growth at 6.7 per cent in fiscal 2027 and 7 per cent in fiscal 2028, S&P Global Ratings said on Monday, adding that the Union Budget reinforces its expectation of gradual fiscal consolidation.

items.title: FPIs pull out ₹36,000 cr from equities in January amid global uncertainties
items.summary: A higher securities transaction tax proposed in the Union Budget may weigh on overseas investor participation in the near future

items.title: Govt considering merger of state-run entities PFC and REC
items.summary: The government is exploring a merger of Power Finance Corporation and REC Ltd. This move is part of a broader restructuring effort for public sector financial institutions. The Power Ministry will work out the details. A similar merger was considered in 2019 but did not materialize. Shares of both companies saw a rise following earlier announcements.

items.title: Budget FY27 to boost farmers' income, strengthen cooperatives: NDDB Chairman
items.summary: New Delhi. The Union Budget 2026-27 offers significant boosts to agriculture and allied sectors. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced a comprehensive package aimed at enhancing farmers' incomes and strengthening the cooperative movement. The animal husbandry sector sees a substantial increase in allocation. A key proposal extends tax benefits to cattle feed, reducing the burden on primary cooperatives.

items.title: UPL Q3 net down 43% to ₹490 cr
items.summary: Shares of UPL gained by 5.1 per cent on the BSE to close at ₹699.40 on Monday

items.title: FM Sitharaman takes a shot at securing the future
items.summary: Capex up 22% at ₹17.14 lakh cr; electronics parts manufacture allocation doubled to ₹40,000 cr; SME Growth Fund gets ₹10,000 cr; markets crash on higher STT on F&O

items.title: Emirates marks 20 years of operations from Thiruvananthapuram
items.summary: Emirates SkyCargo has played a key role in supporting Kerala’s export-led economy by connecting local producers and businesses to global markets

items.title: Lupin launches generic cancer drug in US
items.summary: The company has launched Dasatinib Tablets in strengths of 20 mg, 50 mg, 70 mg, 80 mg, 100 mg and 140 mg, in the US, following the approval from the USFDA

items.title: Market borrowings to rise in FY27, higher supply likely to weigh on bond markets: NSE Report
items.summary: The NSE report highlights that the reliance on market borrowings to finance the gross fiscal deficit (GFD) has increased in recent years

items.title: US futures, world shares slip as worries over Trump's Fed chief pick and AI weigh on markets
items.summary: Concerns over potential shifts in monetary policy under Trump’s Federal Reserve nominee, coupled with fears of an AI investment bubble, have led to significant declines in global markets, particularly in tech-heavy sectors

items.title: FICCI reiterates call for aerospace manufacturing PLI
items.summary: On Sunday the Union Finance Minister announced custom duty waivers on parts and components used in manufacture of civil, training and other aircraft

items.title: Market stability and much-desired value reset for agriculture
items.summary: The allocation of ₹1.63 lakh crore to agriculture—up 7 per cent over last year’s revised estimates—reinforces the government’s commitment to farm income resilience

items.title: Union Budget 2026: No influence of issues with U.S. in customs duty cuts, says Nirmala Sitharaman
items.summary: The Finance Minister added that the Centre has already started using cess proceeds, usually its domain exclusively, in matters that are in the States’ list of responsibilities

items.title: Tata Chemicals Q3 loss widens to Rs 93 crore as margins shrink on rising costs
items.summary: Weak operating performance, lower EBITDA margins and labour code impact weigh on Tata Chemicals’ Q3 results, even as revenue remains largely stable.

items.title: Relaxation to SEZ units on domestic sales will be temporary: Revenue secretary
items.summary: In a bid to alleviate the pressures of fluctuating global trade, Special Economic Zone units now have the chance to tap into the domestic market. This initiative, designed as a limited-time opportunity, will enable SEZ manufacturers to sell their goods directly within the local tariff area.

items.title: Government proposes to exempt award given by Motor Accident Claims Tribunal from income tax
items.summary: According to the Budget document, the provisions of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988, inter alia, provide for compensation and an interest on the compensation to be awarded by the tribunal to an individual or his/her legal heir, on account of death or permanent disability or any bodily injury under the said Act

items.title: Air India grounds Boeing 787-8 over possible fuel control switch defect
items.summary: Air India has grounded a Boeing 787-8 aircraft. A pilot reported a possible defect in the fuel control switch. The airline is working with the manufacturer to investigate. Passenger and crew safety is the top priority. This action follows a directive from the DGCA. All other Boeing 787 aircraft in the fleet were previously checked and found to be clear.

items.title: Bharat-VISTAAR, an AI tool that will integrate all digital agri infra
items.summary: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, in her Budget speech, announced that the government will launch Bharat-VISTAAR, a multilingual AI tool that integrates all agri-tech products and solutions developed by the State and Central governments. What does it mean for farmers? and what are the intricacies involved?

items.title: Rekha Gupta govt’s big decision: Delhi school fee regulation law on hold for 2025–26 after Supreme Court hearing
items.summary: The Rekha Gupta-led Delhi government has told the Supreme Court that the private school fee regulation law will not be enforced in the 2025–26 academic year, citing implementation challenges. School fees will remain frozen at existing levels this year, with the new regulatory framework set to roll out from 2026–27.

items.title: Budget moots comprehensive review of financial sector, PFC, REC to be restructured
items.summary: “Indian banking sector today is characterised by strong balance sheets, historic highs in profitability, improved asset quality and coverage exceeding 98% of villages in the country,” says Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman

items.title: Union Budget 2026: Taxes
Budget seeks to attract global business and investment providing fillip to toll manufacturing, MAT exemptions
items.summary: The finance minister proposed five-year exemption for toll manufacturing of electronic goods in India alongside rationalisation of the MAT regime

items.title: Dhampur Sugar Mills Q3 Results: Net profit jumps 75% YoY to  ₹26.5 crore, revenue improves 14%
items.summary: Dhampur Sugar Mills reported a consolidated net profit of  ₹26.49 crore for the December quarter, up 75.2% from  ₹15.12 crore last year. Revenue rose 14% to  ₹667.44 crore. However, its shares have declined 64.5% since their peak in September 2023.

items.title: Nifty 50 recovers from Budget shock, surges over 1%. Is rally temporary or here to stay? Analysts weigh in
items.summary: The Nifty 50 rebounded 263 points to close at 25,088 after a 2% drop, driven by strong auto stocks and a recovery in metal sectors. Concerns over policy uncertainty and mixed global cues keep the market cautious, with key resistance at 25,210.

items.title: Power consumption grows 3.8% to 142.74 billion units in January
items.summary: India's power consumption saw a significant rise in January.  This increase of 3.8 percent is attributed to the widespread use of heating appliances.  Intense cold conditions across North India drove up demand.  Peak power demand also climbed, reflecting the higher electricity usage.  This trend highlights the impact of weather on national energy needs.

items.title: Bengal allocated Rs 14,205 crore for rail infra, safety projects in 2026-27 budget: Official
items.summary: West Bengal receives a significant boost with Rs 14,205 crore allocated for railway projects in the Union Budget 2026-27. This investment will drive track creation, station redevelopment, and safety enhancements across the state. Projects like the Kavach system and Vande Bharat Express services are already improving travel efficiency.  Over 100 stations are slated for redevelopment, promising modern facilities for passengers.

items.title: Budget 2026 prioritizes healthcare, AIIMS receives substantial financial support from the government
items.summary: The healthcare funding provided to AIIMS will enable the institution to maintain its status as a leading medical center while supporting India's long-term healthcare development objectives.

items.title: Tobacco stocks Godfrey Phillips, ITC, VST Industries extend slide as higher excise duty spurs fresh selling
items.summary: Godfrey Phillips India led the losses, falling as much as 6% in early trade to ₹1,877.30

items.title: India manufacturing PMI rises to 55.4 in January, signals sector rebound
items.summary: Growth was driven by higher domestic demand, new orders, and increased employment, though business confidence slipped to a three-and-a-half-year low. Input prices rose moderately, while factory-gate inflation eased to a 22-month low, creating slight margin pressure

items.title: Sundaram Finance reports 16% rise in net profit in Q3’26
items.summary: The company has declared 160 per cent interim dividend (₹16 per share)

items.title: Singapore-based AP Moller-Maersk to further expand operations in Uttar Pradesh
items.summary: Detailed discussions took place on the vast investment potential in Uttar Pradesh, the industry-friendly business environment and the state government's investment promotion policies

items.title: Uttar Pradesh to promote sugarcane intercropping with pulses and oilseeds
items.summary: The initiative, planned from 2026-27 to 2030-31, aims to increase farmers’ income, optimize production per unit area, and strengthen self-reliance in oilseeds and pulses

items.title: Power consumption grows 3.8% to 142.74 billion units in Jan
items.summary: The peak power demand touched an all-time high of about 250 GW in May 2024. The previous all-time peak power demand of 243.27 GW was recorded in September 2023

items.title: Govt mulling proposal to raise FDI ceiling in public sector banks to 49%: DFS secretary Nagaraju
items.summary: Department of financial services secretary M Nagaraju said the finance ministry was considering raising the FDI limit in PSBs to 49% and that inter-ministerial consultations were being held on the issue.

items.title: ‘Bullet train to run through Bihar’: Ashwini Vaishnaw calls it a game-changer for the state
Budget 2026 aims to build job-ready, formal talent base, say experts
items.summary: The Union Budget 2026-27 focuses on skilling and workforce development. It supports MSMEs and future industries. This aims to create a formal and skilled talent pool across India. Experts believe this budget will drive growth through AI and digital capabilities. It bridges the education and employment gap. Investments in manufacturing and specialized sectors will boost job creation.

items.title: India’s semiconductor moment depends on capability, not just capacity
Bajaj Life Insurance launches ‘BSE 500 Quality 50 Index Fund’
items.summary: Designed for volatile market conditions, the fund focuses on the quality investment factor, which emphasises profitability, balance-sheet strength and earnings discipline

items.title: FM Sitharaman: If you profit from SGB secondary market, government deserves its share
items.summary: SGBs remain tax-free if held to maturity, while capital gains from secondary market trades or early redemption are now taxable.

items.title: GAIL targeting to add 85 new CNG stations in next two years
items.summary: In an investor call, GAIL’s Director for Finance also estimated global prices of natural gas to soften.

items.title: Chennai’s India International Leather Fair showcases 2026’s trends: Corsets, athleisure and cowboy chic
items.summary: At the India International Leather Fair (IILF) in Chennai, manufacturers, designers and institutes presented 2026 leather trends — from embellished outerwear to Western-inspired silhouettes – for buyers from around the world

items.title: Temasek, LIC are said to plan share sales in NSE’s India IPO
items.summary: State Bank of India Ltd. and SBI Capital Markets Ltd are expected to participate as sellers in the upcoming IPO, which will involve existing shareholders offering 4-4.5% of the company’s equity, according to a private source

items.title: India to achieve 4.3% fiscal deficit target for FY27 despite projected dip in GST receipts: S&P
items.summary: S&P Global Ratings is optimistic that India will achieve its fiscal deficit goal for FY27. This assurance persists even with expected declines in Goods and Services Tax receipts resulting from rate adjustments. Enhanced consumer spending and more effective tax collection are likely to elevate GST income, alongside support from central bank dividends and potential underutilization of capital expenditure.

items.title: JS Auto Cast foundry raises ₹300 cr from Premji Invest
items.summary: Following the investment, Premji Invest will hold a 23 per cent stake in JSA on a fully diluted basis

items.title: Mixed reactions from agriculture sector on Union Budget 2026-27
items.summary: The edible oil sector criticised the lack of measures to reduce import dependence, while rice exporters welcomed MSME support, technology interventions, and TReDS procurement reforms

items.title: Accretion Nutraveda IPO allotment to be finalised today: Check steps to track status; latest GMP
items.summary: Accretion Nutraveda IPO was open for bidding from January 28 to January 30. The allotment date for the SME offer is today, February 4. The IPO was oversubscribed by 1.83 times on the final day of the offer.

items.title: India's Budget advances critical reforms across customs and strategic sectors that boost investment: USISPF
items.summary: “The support in the Budget for semiconductors, electronics manufacturing, healthcare, agriculture, and logistics will help fuel next-generation growth,” the President and CEO of USISPF said

items.title: Markets rebound over 1% as investors shrug off budget-day selloff
items.summary: The rally was led by Power Grid, which surged 7.42% to ₹270.00, emerging as the top gainer on the Nifty50; However, selling pressure was visible in select financial and healthcare stocks, with Shriram Finance leading the decliners

items.title: Steel industry players say Union Budget's push towards infra, MSME to support demand
items.summary: The FY27 budget is set to boost India's economy and steel demand. Increased capital spending, support for industrial clusters, and a focus on MSMEs are key. These measures will strengthen infrastructure, improve logistics, and enhance domestic manufacturing. Steel companies expect growth across construction, automotive, and railway sectors. The budget also prioritizes cleaner technologies and modern production facilities.

items.title: Banking review panel key to Viksit Bharat push: Bandhan Bank founder
items.summary: A new High Level Committee on Banking is proposed in the Union Budget. This committee will align the banking sector with India's future growth. It will also ensure financial stability, inclusion, and consumer protection. The budget also outlines clear targets for NBFCs. These targets focus on credit disbursement and technology adoption.

items.title: Government allocates Rs 67,300 cr for Jal Jeevan Mission in Budget for next fiscal
items.summary: The central government has allocated Rs 67,300 crore for the Jal Jeevan Mission. Funds will be released to states upon meeting specific conditions. Significant progress has been made in providing tap water to rural households. Over 15.79 crore rural households now have tap water connections. Eleven states and Union Territories have achieved 100 percent coverage.

items.title: AMD estimates 13.15 million tonne monazite in beach sand deposits across 8 States: Reddy
items.summary: Monazite is a reddish-brown, phosphate mineral rich in rare-earth elements and thorium, primarily sourced from heavy mineral beach sands and igneous rocks

items.title: Ficci director general: The budget isn’t a list of announcements but a coherent plan to strengthen India’s economy
items.summary: The budget provides a coherent growth framework anchored in reform continuity, infrastructure investment and fiscal discipline. Amid global fragility, it signals policy credibility and offers clues to how India plans to sustain its GDP growth, attract capital and strengthen competitiveness

items.title: Union Budget bets on tourism, mobility, human capital for long-term growth: VFS Global
items.summary: The Budget 2026-27 highlights tourism, mobility, and human capital as key drivers for future growth. Initiatives aim to boost travel demand and prepare the workforce for upcoming challenges. The government is fostering a stronger travel ecosystem by supporting sustainable and heritage tourism. Reductions in taxes for overseas travel and education will ease financial burdens for Indian citizens, enhancing global connectivity.

items.title: Ananda Dairy targets ₹10,000 crore revenue by 2030
items.summary: Company plans to increase capacity, product diversification

items.title: Indian stock market volatility persists as global risks and earnings weigh
items.summary: A key factor affecting the performance of the domestic market is the lack of clarity over the US-India trade deal, the lack of a dual diplomatic relationship, and the deep depreciation of the INR, which crossed 92 last week.

items.title: Rupee rises 42 paise to close at 91.51 against U.S. dollar
items.summary: Forex traders said the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) seemed to be defending the 92 per dollar level with a lot of resolve

items.title: Share Market Highlights Feb 2: Benchmarks surge over 1%; Sensex ends at 81,666, Nifty above 25,000
items.summary: Sensex, Nifty updates on 02 February 2026:  Closing bell: Indian equity benchmarks rebounded on Monday after Sunday’s budget-day slump. The Sensex rose 1.17% to 81,666.46 and Nifty 50 climbed 1.06% to 25,088.4, led by gains in infrastructure stocks and Reliance Industries. The rupee strengthened 0.51% to 91.51 versus the U.S. dollar.

items.title: Stock markets rebound over 1% on value buying after Budget day drubbing
items.summary: The 30-share BSE Sensex rallied 943.52 points or 1.17%, to settle at 81,666.46. During the day, it surged 1,009.31 points or 1.25% to a high of 81,732.25

items.title: AAIB says probe into VSR Ventures' Learjet plane crash in Sep 2023 in 'final stages'
items.summary: The Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau is nearing the end of its probe into a Learjet 45 plane crash at Mumbai airport in September 2023. This comes after a similar aircraft from the same company, VSR Ventures, was involved in a fatal crash in Baramati in January 2024. The AAIB has analyzed all evidence for the Mumbai incident.

items.title: Nestle India’s premium growth reflects in its premium valuation
items.summary: Nestle India is near its 52-week high, buoyed by impressive Q3FY26 results that showcased the strongest volume growth in five years. With a strategic increase in advertising and a favourable market recovery, the company is positioned for continued success.

items.title: Budget focusses on investment as tool for growth; deficit target outlines government’s priority, says Sitharaman
items.summary: Union Finance Minister also said the volatility in gold prices is due to global uncertainty, and many central banks are investing in gold.

items.title: Budget 2026: Solar manufacturing and carbon capture measures key to strengthening grid stability, say industry
items.summary: The FY27 Union Budget of India unveils transformative strategies focusing on solar production and carbon capture systems. Thought leaders in the industry are confident that these investments will stabilize the energy grid and accelerate efforts to reduce carbon emissions. With designated funding for carbon capture and solar technology, the government aims to empower industries while ensuring a secure energy future.

items.title: FPIs withdraw ₹36,000 crore in January amid global uncertainties; higher STT to weigh on sentiments
items.summary: The continued selling pressure by FPIs reflects a combination of global and domestic drivers impacting foreign investor sentiment

items.title: Govt to introduce IBC Amendment Bill in second half of Budget session starting Mar 9: FM
items.summary: The proposed amendments to insolvency law would help further enhancement in the timelines and effectiveness of proceedings as well as alignment of India's insolvency regime more closely with the global best practices

items.title: Focus on building value chain in critical minerals in Budget 2026 vital enabler for EVs, next-gen mobility: Industry
items.summary: The Union Budget 2026-27 prioritizes boosting manufacturing in key sectors. It aims to build domestic value chains for critical minerals and rare earths. This focus is crucial for the future of electric vehicles and electronics. Initiatives like dedicated corridors and import duty exemptions will support mining and processing.

items.title: Apple hits record 28 pc value share in India as smartphone market leans towards premium devices
items.summary: Apple has achieved a record 28% value share in India's smartphone market, fueled by a strong 'premiumisation' trend. Consumers are increasingly opting for high-end devices, with Apple's iPhone 16 series leading shipments. This shift is driving overall market value growth, even as volume increases moderately.

items.title: Rupee rises 42 paise to close at 91.51 against US dollar
items.summary: At the end of the trading session on Monday, the rupee was quoted at 91.51 (provisional) against the greenback, registering a gain of 42 paise from its previous close

items.title: Budget 2026: Microwave oven prices unlikely to fall sharply despite duty waiver; local manufacturing to benefit
items.summary: Union Budget of India 2026: New Delhi's latest Union Budget has sparked excitement with its proposal to waive customs duty on components for microwave ovens. This forward-thinking measure is designed to invigorate homegrown manufacturing, giving Indian brands a sharper edge internationally. Sector leaders are buzzing with expectations of increased component procurement and a robust local supply chain.

items.title: Tyre industry hails infrastructure-led growth focus in Budget
items.summary: The tyre sector sees the rise in public capital expenditure to ₹12.2 lakh crore as a major boost for long-term demand growth, given its ties to transport and infrastructure

items.title: Foxconn gets tax demand notice from two gram panchayats, industries dept to intervene
items.summary: Foxconn's Bengaluru facility has received notices from local gram panchayats demanding taxes and land use details. This has created a political stir for the ruling Congress party. The state government plans to intervene, stating the industrial area is managed by KIADB. Foxconn is a major investor in Karnataka's electronics manufacturing sector.

items.title: IIT Madras, Daimler India commercial vehicles sign MoU to develop a driver rating system
items.summary: The driver rating system will use technology and  data-driven approaches to address challenges in safety and wellbeing of truck drivers

items.title: Indian Oil, Vitol venture talks hit snag over some terms, sources say
items.summary:
The ‍joint venture, which the companies had planned to set up
in Asia's oil trading hub Singapore, will initially ‍operate for
five to seven years, a source had previously said, adding that
an exit clause would be included for both partners

items.title: SEZ sale relaxation in Budget FY27 to help promote import substitution, job creation: Commerce Secretary Rajesh Agrawal
items.summary: Special Economic Zone units can now sell goods in India. This move aims to boost local production and create jobs. The government will soon release details on this one-time measure. It allows SEZ units to sell excess production domestically at concessional import duty rates. This will help reduce imports and provide a level playing field for domestic firms.

items.title: Two airports, nine helipads identified in Himachal Pradesh under UDAN scheme: Govt
items.summary: Union Civil Aviation Minister K Rammohan Naidu said that through UDAN scheme, the government has been able to operationalise 657 routes, and 1.59 crore passengers have travelled on these routes as well

items.title: Budget proposals on fisheries draw flak from traditional fishing communities
items.summary: The proposals would allow large fishing vessels to operate within India’s Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ), adversely affecting indigenous fishers and domestic fish production

items.title: Indian Oil–Vitol venture talks stumble: Sources
items.summary: A planned trading joint venture between Indian Oil Corp and global trader Vitol faces delays. Differences over contract clauses, specifically the volume of crude purchases and the timing of an exit clause, are holding up the deal. Indian Oil aimed to leverage Vitol's expertise to expand its international trading. The companies are still negotiating key terms for the venture.

items.title: Airline industry falling behind on clean fuel transition, says IATA chief
items.summary: The airline industry's green transition is stalling as high costs and limited output choke the rollout of cleaner jet fuel, the head of the industry's trade association said on Monday. The trial, which includes Google, state investment firm Temasek and Singapore Airlines, will support Singapore's aim to increasingly favour green jet fuel.

items.title: Defence stocks rebound as budget signals lift sentiment
items.summary: Brokerage Goldman Sachs struck a constructive tone on the sector, highlighting that the overall defence budget has been raised 7% year-on-year to ₹7.85 lakh crore, above its estimate of ₹7.75 lakh crore

items.title: All possible causes of last year’s Air India crash under probe: Govt to RS
items.summary: The civil aviation ministry is investigating the Air India plane crash from last year. All possible reasons for the accident are being examined. Efforts are being made to finish the probe quickly. The Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau is leading the investigation. This crash tragically killed 260 people. The preliminary report indicated fuel supply issues to both engines.

items.title: Govt to introduce Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code amendment Bill in 2nd half of Budget session starting March 9: Sitharaman
items.summary: The Central government plans to introduce the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code amendment Bill soon. This move aims to improve the insolvency resolution process. The government has already resolved over 1,000 companies under the IBC. Further reforms are planned to speed up the process for all stakeholders.

items.title: Hyundai Motor India Q3 profit after tax up 6.35% at ₹1,234.4 crore
items.summary: Consolidated total revenue from operations in the third quarter stood at ₹17,973.49 crore as against ₹16,647.99 crore in the year-ago period

items.title: Goyal meets National Stock Exchange's CEO Ashish Chauhan
items.summary: The government expects to collect ₹73,700 crore through STT in FY27

items.title: National Fibre Scheme to boost exports, says MATEXIL
items.summary: Scheme to help achieve export target of $100 billion by 2030, says MATEXIL Chairman Shaleen Toshniwal

items.title: Royal Enfield sales up 14% to 1,04,322 units in January
items.summary: Royal Enfield Bullet: Domestic sales were at 93,781 units last month, as against 81,052 units in January 2025, up 16 per cent, Royal Enfield said in a statement.

items.title: India govt, RBI in talks with Alipay+ to integrate its instant payment systems, sources say
items.summary:
The move ​would help make payments ⁠easier for Indian tourists
as they would be able to ​use India's ⁠Unified Payments Interface
with merchants in foreign countries who have signed ‌up with
Alipay+

items.title: Lupin rolls out generic oncology drug in US market
items.summary: Drug firm Lupin has launched a generic cancer treatment medication in the US. The company introduced Dasatinib Tablets in various strengths. This product is bioequivalent to Sprycel Tablets. It is indicated for adults with Philadelphia chromosome-positive chronic myeloid leukemia. The US market for Dasatinib Tablets had significant sales.

items.title: IIT Madras and Daimler to develop universal driver rating system
items.summary: The initiative aims to create a digital public infrastructure enabling nationwide adoption for driving assessment, insurance evaluation and background verification

items.title: IIT Bombay develops cruelty-free silk production method that saves silkworms
items.summary: Supported by Coal India under its CSR initiative, the three-year pilot project, Jeevodaya, trains silkworms to lay silk threads on flat surfaces instead of forming cocoons

items.title: Union Budget 2026: Economy
items.summary: A collection of articles on what the Budget offers for the economy.

items.title: Building startups in Kerala: what a decade of Kerala Startup Mission shows
items.summary: From college labs to global markets, Kerala Startup Mission’s decade-long push has shaped how founders scale ideas across robotics, agritech and edtech. From 300 startups in 2016 to over 7,800 today, how has the State shaped Kerala’s technology ecosystem?

items.title: Govt in talks to raise FDI in state-run banks to 49%
items.summary: India allows 74% foreign investment in private banks but ​limits shareholdings of any single foreign institution to ⁠15% unless the Reserve Bank of India grants an exemption

items.title: Hindustan Zinc to raise ₹1,400 cr via debentures
items.summary: The Vedanta group firm’s board approved issuance of unsecured, listed non-convertible debentures

items.title: Rate cuts are done. Liquidity is now the real challenge for RBI
items.summary: The communication will likely stay growth-supportive and emphasize readiness to respond to any downside risks, especially those linked to US tariffs.

items.title: Jaishankar heads to US for critical minerals ministerial
items.summary: The external affairs minister will hold talks with top US administration officials; favourable provisions in FY27 Budget could bolster efforts to fast-track bilateral trade agreement

items.title: Budget 2026 pivots from job counts to employability, services-led growth
items.summary: Union Budget 2026 prioritizes sustainable employment. The focus is on skilling, services, and sector-led ecosystems. Healthcare, the orange economy, and tourism are key growth areas. Education spending will build long-term structures. New institutes and digital infrastructure will support talent development. This approach aims to create jobs and prepare youth for future opportunities.

items.title: Maruti Suzuki to consider price hike due to commodity cost escalation
items.summary: Maruti Suzuki currently has 1.75 lakh pending orders due to production constraints, and in January alone, it received 2.78 lakh bookings, says executive

items.title: Rail connectivity may drive tourism to hill states, but budget lacks incentives: Stakeholders
items.summary: Mahendra Seth pointed out that Himachal Pradesh currently has only three small airports, which can handle limited aircraft operations, restricting air connectivity to the state

items.title: Ashok Leyland sales rise 27% to 21,920 units in January
items.summary: Commercial vehicle maker Ashok Leyland has announced strong sales figures for January. Total sales saw a significant 27 percent increase compared to the previous year. Domestic sales also performed well, rising by 31 percent. This growth was driven by both medium and heavy commercial vehicles, as well as light commercial vehicles.

items.title: CIAL to be made hub for multimodal cargo network: Chief Minister
items.summary: The airport handled over 65,000 tonnes of cargo in the last financial year which is expected to go up to 74,000 tonnes in the current fiscal year

items.title: Bank Holidays in February 2026: Full list of state-wise closures

Regional holidays such as Maha Shivaratri, Losar, Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Jayanti, and Statehood Days in Arunachal Pradesh and Mizoram will also impact banking operations in select states. Customers are advised to plan their banking activities in advance to avoid inconvenience.

items.title: Oil falls further amid growing alarm over coronavirus second wave
items.summary: The biggest global health crisis in a century continues to flare unabated with cases rising in India, Great Britain, Spain and several parts of the United States, where the infection rate has not come under control for months.

items.title: Gold flat as dollar strength counters safe-haven demand
items.summary: Spot gold was little changed at $1,929.30 per ounce by 0038 GMT, after falling to a near two-week week low of $1,906.24 on Tuesday.

items.title: Gold may witness choppy trade, expect buying at lower levels: Kotak Securities
items.summary: After weeks of consolidation, crude oil has come under pressure amid signs of correction in US equity market and gains in US dollar index.

items.title: Energy Weekly Report: Motilal Oswal
items.summary: According to Motilal Oswal, Oil prices hit a rough patch last week, falling back in line with broader financial markets. Prices did try to inch higher, but experienced selling pressure at highs.

items.title: Precious Metals Weekly Report: Motilal Oswal
items.summary: According to Motilal Oswal, Gold fell to the lowest level in a month primarily as the dollar rose against its major crosses and better-than-expected economic number from the US.

items.title: Base Metals Weekly Report: Motilal Oswal
items.summary: According to Motilal Oswal, Base metals traded choppy last week, with prices hitting multi month highs at the start of the week and followed by some profit taking on back of volatility in the dollar and mixed data signals from China and US.

items.title: Flipkart records highest-ever single day sale, grosses $200mn
items.summary: This is the biggest ever single day sale for Bangalore-based Flipkart, since the time the company started in 2007.

items.title: Subramanian Swamy seeks ban on import of cement from Pakistan
items.summary: "Allowing imports of cement from Pakistan, therefore, carried with it the additional risk in that it provides an effective cover for smuggling of contraband goods and harmful weapons and ammunition concealed in cement bags which comes in rakes and trucks, in the hands of disruptionist elements," he said.

items.title: Moneycontrol Exclusive: Govt plans overhaul of tax administration for smooth GST rollout
items.summary: The government has readied plans for a major change in India’s tax administration structure, including overhauling the Central Board of Excise and Customs (CBEC) to ensure a glitch-free roll-out of a nation-wide goods and services tax (GST).

items.title: Sensex, Nifty wobbly; Hind Zinc, SBI, Force Motors most active
items.summary: Asian Paints, SBI, Tata Motors, HUL and Maruti Suzuki are top gainers while ONGC, Axis Bank, MM, Bajaj Auto and Hero MotoCorp are major losers in the Sensex.

items.title: Uber  redBus partner with ixigo for train travellers
items.summary: ixigo, India’s leading mobile travel marketplace has announced partnerships with Uber and redBus to enable instant bookings for cabs and buses natively within ixigo trains app.

items.title: Workload in IT to come down due to AI; jobs to reduce: Genpact
items.summary: But along with that the employment growth rates have started to dip, NV 'Tiger' Tyagarajan says. The percentage addition of employees in India will not be same as past. And due to advancements, a workforce with higher skill sets is required for the IT industry, he says.

items.title: Pixel launch: Is Google Assistant's AI an assault on privacy?
items.summary: Sure, artificial intelligence can make life simpler by suggesting you places to eat, tell you weather, or even crack a joke.  The more you use it, the more it learns about your habits and preferences. The protocols pertaining to artificial intelligence, or the lack of it, make our data less secure and more vulnerable.

items.title: Up over 200% in 1 year, what's buzzing with Borosil Glass?

items.title: Why you should not be always chasing returns

items.summary: In an interview with CNBC-TV18, Satpal Arora, MD of Tourism Finance Corporation of India (TFCI), talked about the state of business and the outlook ahead.

items.title: RBI latest meeting 'diluted' its old policy framework: Nomura
items.summary: On Tuesday, the central bank surprised the market with a 25-basis-point cut to its policy repo rate, or the rate at which it lends to banks, to 6.25 percent.

items.title: Bond bull market may pause but is far from over: Expert
items.summary: The benchmark 10-year government-security yield remained stuck in 8-7.5 percent range through all of 2015 and half of 2016, moving lower to sub-7 percent only when the RBI promised in April to reduce the system's liquidity deficit. The yield may now fall more.

items.title: Scope for meaningful rate cuts going ahead: Neelkanth Mishra
items.summary: Credit Suisse' Neelkanth Mishra expects repo rate to fall to a decade low in the coming quarters. He says that beginning December the market may see a robust and widespread pick-up which may boost indices.

items.title: Endurance Technologies IPO opens: Should you subscribe?
items.summary: The Aurangabad-based company aims to mop up nearly Rs 1,162 crore (at higher end of price band) by diluting 17.5 percent stake through the issue that will close on October 7. It already raised Rs 348.52 crore through anchor investors' portion on Tuesday, the day before issue opening.

items.title: Cautiously optimistic on India; eyeing earnings revival: Sanger
items.summary: Global liquidity tailwinds are unlikely to get any better from now and that makes Arvind Sanger, Managing Partner at Geosphere Capital Management “cautiously optimistic” on the Indian markets.

items.title: Automation threatens 69% jobs in India: World Bank
items.summary: "In large parts of Africa, it is likely that technology could fundamentally disrupt this pattern. Research based on World Bank data has predicted that the proportion of jobs threatened in India by automation is 69 percent, in China it is 77 percent and in Ethiopia, the percentage of jobs threatened by automation is 85 percent," he said.

items.title: Vanguard CEO Ramji Calls Trump Accounts a ‘Fabulous Concept’

items.title: The three factors that drove Hyundai's recovery in India

items.summary: With China tightening exports and private projects yet to take off, there are concerns over whether India is investing enough in its sole operational rare earth supplier.

items.title: Setback for Elon Musk as US judge signals xAI's trade theft allegations against OpenAI may get dismissed
items.summary: Elon Musk's xAI lawsuit against OpenAI may soon be dismissed as a federal judge tentatively supports OpenAI's request. xAI alleged unfair competition and trade secret theft, but the judge found their claims lacked plausibility. xAI may amend its claims if the case is dismissed.

items.title: Rolls Royce Plan for Moon Nuclear Reactor Stalls, Telegraph Says
items.summary: British engine maker Rolls-Royce Holdings Plc has halted a plan backed backed by millions in government funding to put a mini nuclear reactor on the Moon, the Telegraph reported.

items.title: Recall alert: Why automaker Toyota is recalling over 1,61,000 vehicles in the US — All you need to know

items.title: Pro-Beijing Paper Blasts Panama’s Ruling Against CK Hutchison

items.title: Premji Invest picks 23% in Bharat Forge unit for  ₹300 crore

items.title: Palantir stock jumps 8% on strong FY26 revenue forecast, CEO Alex Karp praises ‘Stellar, unusual, sublime’ performance
items.summary: Palantir stock rose 8% after exceeding Wall Street analysts' revenue forecasts for FY26 at $7.19 billion. The company reported Q4 earnings growth of 70%, with earnings per share of 25 cents, also surpassing experts' estimates.&nbsp;

items.title: PE giants line up for RedTape in deal valuing footwear maker at up to  ₹5,000 crore

Despite a small workforce, many employees have become millionaires due to stock appreciation. Nvidia pays competitive salaries across various roles, with large bonuses and equity.

items.title: Former Citibank India CEO Pramit Jhaveri not to seek another term at Sir Dorab Tata Trust

His decision reflects ongoing disagreements among trustees after Noel Tata took over the reins at two key philanthropic entities of the group.
